table1.Name: Brown rice
table1.Notes: Brown rice is widely recognized as a healthier alternative to white rice

table1.Name: Oats
table1.Notes: They’re not only packed with vitamins, minerals and fiber but also naturally gluten-free

table1.Name: Wheat
table1.Notes: It’s a key ingredient in baked goods, pastas, noodles, couscous, bulgur and semolina.

fats.Name: Coconut oil
fats.Notes: When it comes to high heat cooking, coconut oil is your best choice.Over 90% of the fatty acids in it are saturated, which makes it very resistant to heat.

fats.Name: Palm oil
fats.Notes: Palm oil is derived from the fruit of oil palms.It consists mostly of saturated and monounsaturated fats, with small amounts of polyunsaturates.

fats.Name: Butter
fats.Notes: It contains Vitamins A, E and K2. It is also rich in the fatty acids Conjugated Linoleic Acid (CLA) and Butyrate, both of which have powerful health benefits.

dairyEggs.Name: Milk
dairyEggs.Notes: A breakfast essential if you have cereal for breakfast, if prefer your hot drinks a lighter shade of brown, or want to make a sauce.

dairyEggs.Name: Cheese
dairyEggs.Notes: A great standard sandwich filler or for an ingredient in cheesy side-dishes or main courses.

dairyEggs.Name: Eggs
dairyEggs.Notes: these versatile little things are essential ingredients for a cake or can be made many different ways for a quick breakfast or lunch.

fruits.Name: Snake Beans
fruits.Notes: These may be called yard-long beans,asparagus beans or long podded cow peas.

fruits.Name: Beetroot
fruits.Notes: A native of Southern Europe, beetroot has a vibrant crimson colour which comes from pigments no other vegetable has.

fruits.Name: Onion
fruits.Notes: Onions are the most used flavouring vegetables in the world

fruits.Name: Potatoes
fruits.Notes: Potatoes are swollen underground stems, called tubers. Like most common vegetables eaten today.

fruits.Name: Tomatoes
fruits.Notes: The tomatoes is actually a fruit but is considered a vegetable because of its use.

fruits.Name: Shallots
fruits.Notes: They are cosidered the gourment onion and are peferred in French and Asian cooking. Delicious raw or cooked, shallots have a wide range of end uses.

fruits.Name: Ginger
fruits.Notes: Ginger originated in the southern provinces of China and India, where if havs been used in food and medicines for over 5000 years.

fruits.Name: Garlic
fruits.Notes: it is a member of the allium family that also includes onions,chives,shallots,spring onions and leeks.

fruits.Name: Green chilli
fruits.Notes: Green chillies have absolutely zero calories, makeing them the perfect spice ingredient for those focused on th ehealthy diet.

fruits.Name: Cauliflower
fruits.Notes: Cauliflower, from the Latin word meaning 'cabbage flower', is a member of the brassica family.

fruits.Name: orange
fruits.Notes: Juicy, round fruit, shiny orane pitted skin distinctive citrus fragrance and flavour.

fruits.Name: Grape
fruits.Notes: Actually it's a berry. Small round fruits found in bunches.

fruits.Name: Lime
fruits.Notes: Green,samll oval shaped with pointed tip,shiny skin with pale green pulp. Very aromatic citrus fragrance.

fruits.Name: Banana
fruits.Notes: Eat fresh in hand. Fruit salad, accompaniment to meat and curry dishes.

condi.Name: Mayonnaise
condi.Notes: Mayonnaise, informally mayo, is a thick cold condiment or dressing commonly used in sandwiches and composed salads or on French fries.

condi.Name: Soy sauce
condi.Notes: Soy sauce, also spelled as soya sauce, is an East Asian liquid condiment of Chinese origin, traditionally made from a fermented paste of soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and Aspergillus oryzae or Aspergillus sojae molds.

condi.Name: Tomato sauce
condi.Notes: Tomato sauce can refer to many different sauces made primarily from tomatoes, usually to be served as part of a dish, rather than as a condiment.

condi.Name: Hot sauce
condi.Notes: Hot sauce, also known as chili sauce or pepper sauce, is any condiment, seasoning, or salsa made from chili peppers and other ingredients.

condi.Name: Sugar
condi.Notes: Buy artificial sweeteners if you concerned about becoming healthier and cutting back on the calories.

condi.Name: Salt
condi.Notes: this will enhance the flavor in your meals. However, if you’re on a low-sodium diet such as the DASH diet, you might want to replace this with some herbs and spices.

condi.Name: Vinegar
condi.Notes: add some zing to your food. You can also mix this with oil to create a simple and healthy salad dressing.

meat.Name: Chicken
meat.Notes: Skinless chicken, small pieces for frying

snacks.Name: Banana chip
snacks.Notes: Banana chips originated in India are dried, generally crispy slices of bananas.

snacks.Name: Cadbury Oreo
snacks.Notes: Oreo biscuits are available in a variety of flavours which makes them hugely popular in India.

spices.Name: Cardamom
spices.Notes: There are two kinds of cardamom used in Indian cooking: green and black. Green is the more common variety, used for everything from spice mixes to lassis to Indian desserts.

spices.Name: Black pepper
spices.Notes: It is a surprisingly hard spice to grow, as it depends on many natural cycles, like a set amount of rainfall, which is why prices for fresh pepper vary a lot.

spices.Name: Cumin
spices.Notes: Cumin is used frequently whole and in spice mixes to add a characteristic smoky note to Indian dishes. It can be identified by its distinct ridged brown seeds and intense fragrance.

spices.Name: Coriander
spices.Notes: Coriander is probably the most ubiquitous of spices in the Indian spice rack. It is one of the oldest-known spices in the world, and it’s characterized by its golden-yellow color and gently ridged texture.

spices.Name: Mustard seeds
spices.Notes: Mustard seeds can be yellow, black, or brown and are used interchangeably in Indian cooking.Their smoky, nutty flavor is a staple in curries and curry powders, and mustard oil is commonly used in the North of India.

spices.Name: Turmeric
spices.Notes: Turmeric is another common Indian spice. Grown as a rhizome, it can be used fresh (like ginger) or dried. It has been known to have a host of health benefits and is used in a lot of spice mixes and curries.

spices.Name: Red chilli
spices.Notes: Most important spice to add heat to dishes. Large amounts also imparts a subtle red colour to the dish
